body: Closing as this is a redundant issue: (see 8 issues) https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/search?q=ImportError%3A+Missing+optional+dependency+%27tables%27.&type=issues

Hi,
In the latest version of DLC, tables are already installed and pytables are not even there in conda list. Still the same error (optional tables has to be installed) persists. Please help me out. Even complete reinstall of anaconda shows the same error!

> Hi, In the latest version of DLC, tables are already installed and pytables are not even there in conda list. Still the same error (optional tables has to be installed) persists. Please help me out. Even complete reinstall of anaconda shows the same error!

Did you solve this problem yet?
not yet, even reinstalled anaconda and completely started from scratch, still the error persists...

Hi @TinyAnts and @Jason66661010 did you check out the other threads? This typically happens if you don't have admin permissions, so please check the threads above carefully. As you point out, it is installed with deeplabcut when you run pip install deeplabcut, so this is very operating system+user specific issue that there can't be more that we can do aside from pointing down the paths ;/.

Yeah read every single thread, most of it is for older versions and it is related to pytables vs tables...the newer version does not have those issues. I installed everything from the yaml file based env creation though to avoid any issues. Still could not find a solution, is there a way to create csv to h5 file, I even tried the helper function in utils, it has its own bunch of errors. Do you recommend different OS or conda based installation or my own env with just pip install deeplabcut or it is due to gui (I used this)or non-gui version? Please let me know thanks in advance though...for your time.
its the same issue though; i.e., if you don't open terminal by right click "as an admin" then this will happen, I assume you are using windows?

Yeah actually opened via admin access and ran the sample demo jupyter book, still got the same error. But did not create env with admin access I guess (just std terminal intallation), now I am trying to install again and create env once again via yaml file with admin access. Let's see how it goes! thanks for the continual support!
Did the admin access stuff, installed and ran everything from admin, still the same error though...

Hi,
I finally fixed the error!
Solution - Avoid using the yaml file at this point. Manually install all the libraries needed by reading the yaml file and making sure versions are matching as well... But the team is very responsive and very helpful for the most part... a great library to play with...Thanks to the devs...

Great!  BTW, I think the error might have been simple; in Jupyter when you open it, you need to be sure you select the correct env kernel: maybe DEEPLABCUT was not selected?

![Screen Shot 2021-11-23 at 9 19 24 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28102185/143097726-f80fafdc-3a8a-455a-83d2-80bb6206b870.png)

PS - also you could also use COLAB for free, just so you can move forward (and trust me the code works 🤗), i.e. here you can upload your project folder to google drive, etc: https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/tree/master/examples/COLAB

Yeah, for sure thanks for the colab recommendations! definitely have to start using it more often. 

And also I always checked that I had the right kernel selected though...I tried on a different PC as well, just in case. Just a heads-up if someone comes up with the same error, maybe if they manually install the libraries it might solve the issues and also maybe the yaml file has to be checked or revamped I guess...But overall one of the coolest libraries to use though! thanks again...Soon I can imagine when we combine vision transformers in the pipeline for better temporal relations between the frames... Maybe I can start writing code sooner to compare performances... Keep up the good work!

About myself, I am a graduate machine learning engineer (TU Berlin dual masters) and veterinary medicine student (currently studying)  & working on animal behavior/protien expr/gene expr at the moment out of interest!  
LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/nagaraj21/

> Avoid using the yaml file at this point. Manually install all the libraries needed by reading the yaml file and making sure versions are matching as well...

could you offer me a list of all the packages please?  I tried your way but still got the same error. Maybe somewhere the version of  some packages are still incompatible...  Thanks a lot for your help!!!

@Jason66661010 there is zero you need aside from running in the terminal `pip install 'deeplabcut[gui]'` the conda file is just if you are a conda user and want to use it. Nothing is installed from the conda file that affects deeplabcut.

> > Avoid using the yaml file at this point. Manually install all the libraries needed by reading the yaml file and making sure versions are matching as well...
> 
> could you offer me a list of all the packages, please? I tried your way but still got the same error. Maybe somewhere the version of some packages is still incompatible... Thanks a lot for your help!!!

Hi, I created a new env, with python 3.8, then filled with PyTorch with cuda 11.5 as it installs most of the basic libs in parallel even though we don't need PyTorch in the code, then installed TensorFlow GPU and look at conda list you might get the tables also preinstalled as well...so just hop on to the code and run the demo jupyter notebooks given by the devs of this repo...Hope this was helpful....

> @TinyAnts check out; https://arxiv.org/abs/2103.12115

looks like you guys are already at work! and it also beats the R50 in most areas as well that is so cool...Will this be integrated in the DLC REPO soon? is there a public GitHub version of this implementation?
